PErceptor:

"We should do it with Nightlight First, after we restore her to her 
primitive self"said Perceptor"She is who are in the most imediate risk... 
ok"he said while he faced Staton and the others "I need your help... I need 
you to be my eyes... this place isnt designed to allow me do my job I'll 
tell you what to do and you will tell me what is going on with a wide 
detaill, the most insignificant thing could be vital. Our firts step would 
be delete both programs, the Predacon program is more agressive and 
posessive and I foresee that it would be the most problematic... The MAximal 
one may be corrupted or damaged... till her memories are restored  and with 
them her bonds with maximals we must be carefull cause she wont know if we 
are enemies or foes... in your case anyway cause I doubt that she would be 
happy to see me. Start when you are ready..."

-----Original Message----- 
From: Sandy
Sent: Wednesday, October 20, 2010 11:19 PM
To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: The Awakening

Tucson knew he had done the right thing, waiting for Rodimus to make the 
first important decision.  He would have done the same for his offspring if 
he had any.  Which brought him to think about Talon, and his future with 
her.  His love for her would never wane, and now, more than ever, he wanted 
so much to strengthen their bond.  But he had to conscentrate on the tasks 
at hand now.  After all, like Rodimus He too must carry himself like a 
Prime.  He gives a smile of approval, as Straight Shot transforms and 
connects herself to his back, in cross bow mode.

" Now that we have Nightlight, Rodimus and Windlord back with us here, it's 
time to think about how we're going to weaken Hydras and the insectoids, 
thus returning this planet to a more peaceful state of being.  We were not 
the only ones affected by Hydras, I'm sure of it, so if we do this in our 
honor, we should carry out our mission for the preservation of this planet, 
and the innocent who reside here.  After all, it's what we do best, all of 
us."

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...> wrote:

> Rodimus nodded thoughtfully as Perceptor sppoke, his face going from
> what was mild alarm slowly into a more relaxed posture. He stood up
> and walked towards he daughter, scooping her up into his arms, "You
> have been through a lot today young one." he said, his voice serious
> as he looked at her, "This is not a choice that can be made lightly.
> Once we put that on you *we* might have trouble finding you too should
> you get lost."
>
> Rodimus began to pace, holding Elita in his arms as he did so, his
> thoughts churning. He looked over at the comotose form of his wife,
> his optics still worried. So many choices to make, so many dangers.
>
> He sighed and turned to Perceptor, "Do it." he said.
